name: Chi Sense
description: The Kitsune may sense the ebb and flow of Yin and Yang through the world around her. The player permanently adds one die to any Gift or Rite which inspects or alters the environment around the Kitsune.

name: Ishin Deshin
description: As the Galliard Gift: Mindspeak. By invoking the power of waking dreams, the Garou can place any chosen characters into silent communion.

name: Scent of Running Water
description: As the Ragabash Gift. The Garou can mask her scent completely, making herself virtually impossible to track.

name: Persuasion
description: This Gift allows a homid to become more persuasive when dealing with others, in such a way that his statements and arguments are imbued with added meaning or credibility.

name: Seduction
description: A Fox with this Gift can cause humans to fall in love with her.

name: Smell of Man
description: Creatures of the wild have learned well that where man goes, death follows. With this Gift the werewolf enhances the human scent around him greatly, causing wild animals to feel uneasy and nervous. However, the scent also causes domestic animals to recognize the werewolf as their master.

name: Burrow
description: As the metis Gift. Those who learn this Gift gain the ability to burrow through the earth. They make a real tunnel, and others can follow them through it. The digger creates a burrow just large enough for her to go through.

name: Cricket Leap
description: As the lupus Gift: Hare's Leap. By invoking this Gift, the werewolf may leap incredible distances.

name: Heightened Senses
description: As the lupus Gift. The werewolf with this Gift tunes in to the world around him, increasing his senses vastly. When in Homid or Glabro form, her senses become as sharp as those of a wolf, allowing him to hear sounds beyond his normal range, granting him superior night vision and making his sense of smell stronger than that of any dog.

name: Flow of Aura
description: The Kitsune feels the emotional aura of a place â€” the imprint left behind by events of great sorrow, joy, aggression, and the like.

name: Scent of the True Form
description: The Philodox is able to scent the truth of those she meets, literally sniffing out an individual's true form.

name: Sense Wyrm
description: The werewolf can sense manifestations of the Wyrm in the nearby area. This Gift involves a mystical sense, not a visual or olfactory image, although werewolves using the Gift sometimes say things like, 'This place stinks of the Wyrm'.

name: Blessing the Blade
description: The sorcerer calls on a local spirit to inhabit a blade for a finite time to enhance it with supernatural power. If prepared in advance, special wrappings restrain the spirit until the bearer speaks an enemy's name.

name: Breath of Yu-Chiang
description: As the Black Fury Gift: Curse of Aeolus. The Fury calls up a thick, eerie fog that obscures vision and unnerves her opponents. The Fury can see through the fog, but all others have trouble navigating by sight.

name: Shroud
description: As the Uktena Gift. The Garou can create a field of inky blackness through which only she can see.

name: Spirit Snare
description: As the Theurge Gift. The Theurge casts out an invisible, mystic net which entangles hostile spirits, confounding them with a mixture of magical force and long-broken but still potent Gaian law.

name: Falling Touch
description: As the Ahroun Gift. This Gift allows the Garou to send her foe sprawling with but a touch.

name: Razor Claws
description: As the Ahroun Gift. By raking his claws over stone, steel, or another hard surface, the Ahroun hones them to razor sharpness.

name: Resist Pain
description: As the Philodox Gift. Through force of will, the Philodox is able to ignore the pain of his wounds and continue acting normally.

name: Sense Hostility
description: The Eji can sense hostile beings within 100 feet.

name: Blur of the Milky Eye
description: As the Ragabash Gift. The Garou's form becomes a shimmering blur, allowing him to pass unnoticed among others. Once the Garou has been seen, however, this Gift is negated until the viewer has again been distracted.

name: Clear the Mind
description: As the Children of Gaia Gift: Calm. This Gift imparts the secret of quelling the anger in others.

name: Mother's Touch
description: As the Theurge Gift. The Garou is able to heal the wounds of any living creature, aggravated or otherwise, simply by laying hands over the afflicted area. The Garou may not heal herself, spirits or the undead with this Gift.

name: Open Seal
description: With this Gift, the Garou can open nearly any sort of closed or locked physical device.

name: Beast Speech
description: As the Galliard Gift. The werewolf with this Gift may communicate with any animals from fish to mammals. This Gift does not change their basic reactions; most animals are still afraid of predators such as werewolves.

name: Fable
description: The Kataribe uses her expression and will to sway onlookers. By telling a tale or singing a song, she can plant a suggestion in the minds and hearts of listeners.

name: Perfect Recall
description: As the Galliard Gift. As mentioned earlier in this chapter, Galliards often share one trait even before the Change takes them. That trait is memory. Moon-Dancers often have good heads for detail; this Gift, however, accentuates that capacity.

name: Truth of Gaia
description: As the Philodox Gift. As judges of the Litany, Philodox have the ability to sense whether others have spoken truth or falsehood.

name: Lantern
description: By crafting a paper lantern or similar kami, the Kitsune can infuse it with an eerie light. The light is as bright as that of a mundane paper lantern, and lasts for one scene.

name: Umekochi's Mouth
description: The Kitsune crafts a small paper cup, dish, or other container, which can hold four times as much as it should.

name: Element Child
description: The Kitsune can create a small amount of one of the basic elements by destroying a kami bearing that element's symbol. The Kitsune prepares the kami by writing a mandala showing the elements in relation to each other.

name: Moon Dance
description: The Kitsune becomes completely invisible so long as no moonlight touches her. She may step in and out of moonlight, appearing and vanishing as she does.

name: Sense Magic
description: As the Uktena Gift. The Uktena can discern magical energies, whether they emanate from Garou Gifts, vampiric wizardry or even human magic.

name: Spirit Speech
description: As the Theurge Gift. This Gift allows the Garou to communicate with encountered spirits. The Garou is thus able to address them whether they wish to be addressed or not.

name: Jam Technology
description: The werewolf can cause technological devices to cease functioning, albeit temporarily. Even the simplest of shaped objects will refuse to perform its function.

name: Silver Tongue
description: As the Fianna Gift: Glib Tongue. This Gift makes listeners hear whatever they wish to hear. The Fianna can say anything, even total gibberish, but anyone listening will agree heartily.

name: Staredown
description: By staring into the eyes of a human or animal, a werewolf can cause the target to flee in terror. This Gift can be used against other werewolves, but the target will freeze in place rather than flee.

name: Name the Spirit
description: A werewolf with this Gift becomes familiar with the ways of the Umbra. He can sense the type and approximate Trait levels (Rage, Gnosis, Willpower) of spirits.

name: Scent of Sight
description: As the lupus Gift. The werewolf can compensate for her vision completely by using her sense of smell. She can attack invisible creatures normally or navigate roughly in absolute darkness.

name: Sense Imbalance
description: The Kitsune can sense if any one of the Triat has upset the balance in the area. She knows if the Weaver is too strong, or if the Wyld is lacking.

name: Call to Duty
description: The White Howler Version is called Spectral Authority. Any spirit the Philodox knows by name is a potential servitor. With this Gift, the werewolf can summon and command any spirit she knows by name.

name: Imperial Authority
description: Shinju can assert their superiority by staring into another's eyes. Animals fawn, while humans and shen assume the Ninetails is of superior social standing.

name: Past Whispers
description: The Kitsune can learn the thoughts impressed upon a place. Intense thought fragments (especially those spoken aloud) may linger for years.

name: Blood Omen
description: The Fox reads the future through blood sacrifice. The actual divination is performed by reading entrails, interpreting the smoke of a burnt offering, casting bones, or in some other way using the resulting body as an oracular tool.

name: Command Spirit
description: As the Theurge Gift. The Theurge can give simple commands to encountered spirits and expect a measure of compliance. This Gift does not grant the ability to summon spirits.

name: Shadows at Dawn
description: As the Uktena Gift. Sometimes, one must give information to get information. However, Uktena are notoriously tightfisted with secrets. With this Gift, the werewolf can share a bit of knowledge that later vanishes from the subject's memory.

name: Sight from Beyond
description: As the Theurge Gift. When danger stalks the Garou or momentous events are in the offing, visions begin striking the Garou without warning. The nature of the danger is veiled in metaphor.

name: Bolt
description: The Kitsune calls a bolt of raw elemental force to strike his foe â€” fire, lightning, and freezing wind are all possibilities.

name: Shadow-Fan-Flowers
description: One creature within the Kitsune's line of sight sees a vision and believes. The illusion is perfectly detailed with color, light, and motion.

name: Forgetfulness
description: The Kitsune can erase an individual's memories of a specific event.

name: Spirit Ward
description: As the homid Gift. A werewolf with this Gift may protect himself from spirits by performing a quick warding rite. To use this Gift, the werewolf draws an invisible pictogram in the air that scares and unnerves any nearby spirits (except pack totems or caern spirits).

name: Carrion Clothes
description: Wild foxes catch birds by pretending to be dead; werefoxes aspire to bigger game. This Gift causes the Kitsune to appear to all natural and supernatural examination to be dead.

name: Forest Lord
description: As the lupus Gift: Beast Life. The werewolf with this Gift can communicate with other wild animals and attract (or even command) them. Domesticated animals will speak with the werewolf, but they have given themselves to the ways of humans and must be persuaded to obey the Garou.

name: Roll Over
description: As the Philodox Gift. The Philodox can call on her power to radiate a commanding presence that compels others to submit to her.

name: Scent of Beyond
description: As the Philodox Gift. The werewolf can bring all his senses to bear on one spot with which he is familiar (even an Umbral site), no matter how far away that spot is.

name: Grasp the Beyond
description: As the Theurge Gift. The Garou may take things to and from the Umbra without having to dedicate them to herself. This Gift affects humans and animals, both willing and unwilling.

name: Spirit Drain
description: As the Theurge Gift. The Garou may drain power from a spirit to feed his own resolve.

name: Fooling the Tiger
description: As the Stargazer/Theurge Gift: Ultimate Argument of Logic. Those who speak with the Garou leave convinced of some fact might otherwise have disbelieved.

name: Elemental Meld
description: The Eji may transform into any physical element (earth, water, fire or air), allowing her to merge with and move through that element. On attaining rank five, the Kitsune can change into secondary elements (mist, electricity, moonlight, etc.) as well.

name: Sorcerous Bite
description: The Kitsune can transform her teeth into any substance she wills, most commonly silver or jade. They are uncommonly strong, regardless of the substance chosen.

name: Moon-Fan-Face-Shadow
description: As the Glass Walker Gift: Doppelganger. The Garou may take the exact likeness of any other human, wolf or Garou.

name: Whelp Body
description: As the Ragabash Gift. With this Gift a Garou may deliver a devastating curse upon a foe's body, causing it to weaken or palsy. Many consider the use of this power on a foe to be a declaration of unending war.

name: Kuei Dance
description: This Gift calls on the dead to bear witness. There is no compulsion, but the dead are eager to be remembered, so rarely refuse. The spell may take any form, from story to song to dance, with the ghost acting out her part as appropriate.

name: Shadows by the Firelight
description: As the Galliard Gift. By invoking the power of shadows and dreams, the Galliard may create interactive stories in which others take part â€” willingly or not.

name: Beast Shape
description: As the Ragabash Gift: Thousand Forms. The Kitsune may take the form of the animal depicted by this kami.

name: Walk
description: This last-minute escape route allows the Kitsune to vanish from sight as she tears the kami, reappearing in the Mirror Lands in the form of her choice.

name: Possession
description: The Kitsune abandons her body to take over another's.

name: Assimilation
description: As the homid Gift. A werewolf with this Gift blends smoothly into any culture, no matter how strange or unfamiliar he might normally find it.

name: Call to Allies
description: This Gift is the Kitsune's ultimate distress call. Her Batsu, clan, and sentai will hear it, along with all other friendly neutrals and unknown allies in the area, as well as local spirits and spiritually sensitive mortals.

name: Elemental Gift
description: As the lupus Gift. The werewolf calls upon the primal force of Gaia Herself, thereby commanding the spirits of the elements to rise up, undulate forward and even engulf foes.

name: Song of the Great Beast
description: As the lupus Gift. To use this Gift, the werewolf must travel to the deep wilderness. When she reaches her destination, she howls the Song of the Great Beast into the sky, summoning one of the Great Beasts to her aid.

name: Imperial Obligation
description: As the Philodox Gift: Geas. This Gift places its target under a geas, a sacred oath to obey the Philodox's bidding.

name: Marionette
description: The Kitsune can make the target move in whatever fashion she wishes by mimicking the desired action.

name: Feral Lobotomy
description: As the Theurge Gift. With but a thought, the Garou can devolve an opponent's mind to that of an animal, effectively destroying his intelligence.

name: Malleable Spirit
description: As the Theurge Gift. The Garou can change a spirit's form or purpose.

name: Seal of Inari
description: The sorcerer can secretly 'brand' anyone he encounters with sigils only Kitsune can see. These may be warnings, death marks, requests for help, etc.

name: Dragon Ally
description: As the lupus Gift: Song of the Great Beast, save that it summons forth a dragon made of one of the elements.

name: Fire Immunity
description: As the Ahroun Gift: Kiss of Helios. The Ahroun can invoke the sun's power to become completely immune to the damaging effects of fire.

name: Madness
description: As the metis Gift. The metis struggles his whole life to find a place, a purpose and a sense of stability in his horrifying existence. With this Gift, he can force others to face their inner demons, including insanity and madness.

name: Mist on the Water
description: As the Fianna Gift: Fog on the Moor. This Gift transforms the Fianna into a ghostly outline of himself, allowing him to pass through anything except silver as though he were incorporeal.

name: Violation
description: As the Ragabash Gift. Those few Garou privy to the secret of Violation know well the hate and revulsion of others.
